fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28225].
  {panel}


{panel:title=Atlassian Update: April 30, 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi all,

Thank you for your continued feedback and support on this issue.

We're currently doing some research to better understand how we can solve this problem and how organisations use groups. We'd love to hear from you if you are able to provide any more context on this topic. Your feedback will go a long way to helping shape the roadmap and solutions we build.

If you're interested, please email twalsh@atlassian.com and I'll schedule a quick chat with you.

Regards,
Tamarah Walsh
Product Designer, Atlassian
{panel}


Often times, I'd like to mention an entire group in JIRA rather than individual users. 

Obviously this has the potential to be abused in large instances such as this, but the ability to disable combined with a list of groups that can be mentioned could mitigate these concerns.

An additional safe-guard may be to limit who can mention certain groups.
fields.summary: Mentions of groups
Bad group list on comment visibility

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28223].
  {panel}

The Share feature added in JIRA 5.0 has the potential to be quite valuable, but as they are today, all they do is save a copy-and-paste operation.

The biggest gap is in using the Share feature on the Issue Navigator.  This could be very useful if it e-mailed the list of issues, in the same way that a filter subscription already does.  As it stands, the Share feature only sends a link to the issue...but there's already the long-standing "permalink" button just to the left of Share that gives me that URL already.  So, as it exists today, the Share button only saves me pasting the permalink into an e-mail, and provides almost no additional value.

When Sharing an individual issue, most of what I've said above is true (in that case, I don't even need to click permalink, I can just use the issue's URL), but the e-mail has a little more relevant data, especially in the Text version.

Note that knowing the velocity templates used by these functions (i.e. which could be customized for a JIRA instance) would be an acceptable workaround for this problem (provided the velocity template for Sharing filter results could be modified to include the results themselves).
fields.summary: Please make Share e-mails more informative

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28221].
  {panel}

Hello developer and support-team,

we need a separated permission in "Permission Scheme" for version and component administration.

At the moment I can only grant "Administer Projects". But a user with this rights can modify Project-Role-Membership. This is not my goal.

Possibly it's easyer to separat a Project-Role-Membership-administration to a new permission.

I hope this idea was accepted, because we need this subdivision.

Best regards
lolo
fields.summary: separated permissions in "Permission Scheme" for version and component administration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28219].
  {panel}

Basically, we want to prevent people from managing versions, since these are standards across a big set of projects (~400) and created automatically. This right should be reserve to system administrators.
However other parts of project administration (e.g. components) are not standardized and should remain freely editable for users with project administration rights.

So we'd like to see some more granular project admin rights, where we can restrict version management rights to system admins without preventing project admins to do other project administration tasks.

See this [question|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/53962/how-can-i-disable-the-manage-versions-link-at-the-right-by-developing-a-plugin-or-some-other-way] for more details.
fields.summary: Provide more granular project administration rights

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28218].
  {panel}

It is difficult to understand how to save a filter after editing it. 
Please, see the steps to reproduce:

0. Go to a Project
1. Select _Issues > Manage_ Filters
2. Create and save a filter "*TestFilter*"
3. Select Edit in 'gear' icon drop down (in order to edit "TestFilter").
4. Select Edit link from near upper-left corner (in order to edit
the filter criteria).
5. Modify anything about the filter query details.

* It would be good to have a *save* button here.

6. You have to press the *search* button.
7. It'll appear the "Filter modified since loading" message.
8. Now, you'll need to go to the *Summary* tab.
9. And, under *Operations* click on *Save changes to filter*.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28208].
  {panel}

The current documentation on [creating a notification scheme|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+a+Notification+Scheme] is incorrect in stating the following:
{quote}
JIRA is pre-packaged with a notification scheme called Default Notification Scheme which, by default, is associated with all newly-created projects. 
{quote}

The way that JIRA works is that the user has to:
* Create the project eg: "test"
* Go to admin > Click on Projects > "test"
* Scroll to Notifications > Scheme > None
* Actions > Select a Scheme
* Scheme > Default Notification Scheme > Associate

This is the case for 4.4.x and 5.0.x as far as it has been tested.
fields.summary: Creating a Notification Scheme Doc - Default notification scheme is not automatically associated as written

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28199].
  {panel}

I would like to configure custom fields as mandatory only on special occasions, e. g. workflow status etc. 

E. g. need a specific information (custom field dropbox), when status is resolved?

see     JIRA Support     JSP-125707


Shapla Khanam [Atlassian] added a comment - 08/May/12 2:05 AM

Hi Monika,

Thanks for contacting Atlassian Support, pleased to meet you .

    Is it possible to configure JIRA, that fields are mandatory, when status values are different?
    E. g. need a specific information (custom field dropbox), when status is resolved?

Unfortunately, this is not possible in JIRA at the moment. However, if you would like to see this feature implemented in a future version of JIRA please submit a feature request at:

http://jira.atlassian.com

For more information on how Atlassian implements new features and improvement please see the following document:

    Implementation of New Features and Improvements

We will track it as an improvement request. Please let us know if you require any further assistance.

Cheers,
Shapla
Atlassian Support

  {panel}

When importing users into JIM from .csv files there is a use case for giving users the option to do something of the following:
* Import all those users, and put them into the jira-users group for example
* Import all those users, but have them as users who are not in any groups (not active and will not count towards the license count)
* Do not import users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28173].
  {panel}

It seems that JIRA users who do not have permission to access Confluence can still see the status updates of Confluence users.  

Steps to replicate (per-requisite: Set up JIRA and Confluence application link):
# Set up Confluence to use JIRA user base
# Create a user that does not have access to Confluence.  In other words, users can only access JIRA.  For example JIRAuser
# A user in Confluence [updates his/her status|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF34/Viewing+Status+Updates]
# Login to JIRA as a user who does not have permission to Confluence.  This user is still able to see the status updates of Confluence Users from JIRA Activity Stream.
fields.summary: Users who do not have permission to access Confluence are able to see Confluence's status update on JIRA Activity Stream

fields.description:
I was trying to set up a script listener that would fire an email if an issue was moved into critical priority. 

I used the following email template in the preview, and it worked fine:

----------------------
Dear <% out << issue.assignee?.fullName %>,
 
The $issue.issueType.name $issue.key with priority <% out << issue.priority?.name %> has been assigned to you.
 
Description: ${issue.description}
 
Regards,
<% out << issue.reporter?.fullName %>
----------------------------

However, when I tried to update the script listener I got an error:

Oops - an error has occurred
System Error

A system error has occurred.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28104].
  {panel}

It seems that REST requests require time codes as the following for example:
{code}
2012-05-05T01:01:01.123+1000
{code}
The following time codes do not work:
{code}
2012-05-05T01:01:01
2012-05-05T01:01:01Z
2012-05-05T01:01:01+1000
2012-05-05T01:01:01.123
2012-05-05T01:01:01.123Z
{code}

The failed response headers:
{code}
Request URL:http://localhost:5003/rest/api/2/issue/HSP-2/worklog
Request Method:POST
Status Code:500 Internal Server Error
Request Headersview source
Accept:*/*
Accept-Charset:ISO-8859-1,utf-8;q=0.7,*;q=0.3
Accept-Encoding:gzip,deflate,sdch
Accept-Language:en-US,en;q=0.8,en-AU;q=0.6
Connection:keep-alive
Content-Length:59
Content-Type:application/json
Cookie:remember=localadmin:7:6ed34746f5098e7289fbe02c9daad8db; crucibleprefs1="D%3D1331875449435"; jira.conglomerate.cookie=; doc-sidebar=283px; confluence.browse.space.cookie=space-blogposts; AJS.conglomerate.cookie="|upm.tab=manage"; gh.i=%7B%7D; JSESSIONID=287BF7E26194C9779CFD98C334C6F0A7; atlassian.xsrf.token=AG87-S37R-QM8W-6VWE|cf47098c9c82f06c08660286b925763668dd762a|lin; __utma=1.1602233020.1335846110.1336345641.1336351466.5; __utmc=1; __utmz=1.1335846110.1.1.utmcsr=(direct)|utmccn=(direct)|utmcmd=(none)
Host:localhost:5003
Origin:chrome-extension://cokgbflfommojglbmbpenpphppikmonn
User-Agent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/535.19 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/18.0.1025.168 Safari/535.19
Request Payload
{"started": "2012-05-05T01:01:01+1000", "timeSpent": "5m"}
Response Headersview source
Cache-Control:no-cache, no-store, no-transform
Connection:close
Content-Type:application/json;charset=UTF-8
Date:Mon, 07 May 2012 01:22:50 GMT
Server:Apache-Coyote/1.1
Transfer-Encoding:chunked
X-AREQUESTID:682x95x1
X-ASESSIONID:7gl0gd
X-AUSERNAME:test
X-Seraph-LoginReason:OK
{code}

The failed response:
{code}
{"errorMessages":["Internal server error"],"errors":{}}
{code}

An internal server error here doesn't help with understanding that the timecode is incorrect. This should return a more descriptive error, or support the ISO 8601 standard.

h3. To reproduce:
Use the Google Chrome REST Console, enter request URI, eg:
{code}
http://localhost:5003/rest/api/2/issue/HSP-2/worklog
{code}
Request method: POST
Content-Type: application/JSON
RAW body, eg:
{code}
{"started": "2012-05-05T01:01:01+1000", "timeSpent": "5m"}
{code}
fields.summary: Rest GET request to use standard time formatting or provide useful error messages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28076].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a custom field Cascading Select
# Add the options into it
# Create an issue
# Select 'NONE' for the Cascading Select custom field
The issue successfully created without exception
# Edit the same issue and select 'NONE' for the Cascading Select custom field again
The following error appear and the update fail:
{noformat}
2012-05-04 18:18:58,904 http-8503-6 ERROR kahloun.foong 1098x176x1 2zrt38 127.0.0.1 /secure/QuickEditIssue.jspa [jira.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService] Exception occurred editing issue: java.lang.NullPointerException
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.CascadingSelectCFType.getChangelogValue(CascadingSelectCFType.java:390)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.CascadingSelectCFType.getChangelogValue(CascadingSelectCFType.java:69)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.CustomFieldImpl.getChangelogValue(CustomFieldImpl.java:378)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.CustomFieldImpl.updateValue(CustomFieldImpl.java:418)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.CustomFieldImpl.updateValue(CustomFieldImpl.java:399)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.updateFieldValues(DefaultIssueManager.java:589)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.updateIssue(DefaultIssueManager.java:554)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService.update(DefaultIssueService.java:272)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService.update(DefaultIssueService.java:246)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
{noformat}

*Workaround*
# Shutdown JIRA
# Backup and modify the file {{<jira-install>\atlassian-jira\WEB-INF\classes\templates\plugins\fields\edit\edit-cascadingselect.vm}} from
{noformat}
<select class="select cascadingselect-parent" id="${customField.id}" name="${customField.id}">
        <option class="default-option" value="">$i18n.getText("common.words.pleaseselect")</option>
        <option class="default-option" value="-1">$i18n.getText("common.words.none")</option>
        #foreach ($option in $configs.options.rootOptions)
            #if(!$option.disabled || $option.disabled == false || ($selectedParent && $selectedParent == $option.optionId.toString()))
                <option class="option-group-$option.optionId" value="$option.optionId"#if ($selectedParent && $selectedParent == $option.optionId.toString()) selected="selected"#end>$cfValueEncoder.encodeForHtml($option.value)</option>
            #end
        #end
    </select>
    <select class="select cascadingselect-child" id="${customField.id}:1" name="${customField.id}:1">
        <option class="default-option" value="">$i18n.getText("common.words.pleaseselect")</option>
        <option class="default-option" value="-1">$i18n.getText("common.words.none")</option>
        #foreach ($parentOption in $configs.options.rootOptions)
            <option class="option-group-$parentOption.optionId" value="">$i18n.getText("common.words.pleaseselect")</option>
            <option class="option-group-$parentOption.optionId" value="-1">$i18n.getText("common.words.none")</option>
{noformat}
to
{noformat}
<select class="select cascadingselect-parent" id="${customField.id}" name="${customField.id}">
        <option class="default-option" value="">$i18n.getText("common.words.none")</option>
        <!-- <option class="default-option" value="-1">$i18n.getText("common.words.none")</option> -->
        #foreach ($option in $configs.options.rootOptions)
            #if(!$option.disabled || $option.disabled == false || ($selectedParent && $selectedParent == $option.optionId.toString()))
                <option class="option-group-$option.optionId" value="$option.optionId"#if ($selectedParent && $selectedParent == $option.optionId.toString()) selected="selected"#end>$cfValueEncoder.encodeForHtml($option.value)</option>
            #end
        #end
    </select>
    <select class="select cascadingselect-child" id="${customField.id}:1" name="${customField.id}:1">
        <option class="default-option" value="">$i18n.getText("common.words.none")</option>
        <!-- <option class="default-option" value="-1">$i18n.getText("common.words.none")</option> -->
        #foreach ($parentOption in $configs.options.rootOptions)
            <option class="option-group-$parentOption.optionId" value="">$i18n.getText("common.words.none")</option>
            <!-- <option class="option-group-$parentOption.optionId" value="-1">$i18n.getText("common.words.none")</option> -->
{noformat}
# Restart JIRA
This modification will remove the 'Please select' in the option and replace it with the word 'None'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28054].

Whilst working on JRADEV-10913 I encountered a bug which I could reproduce only in IE9 (didn't try IE8 yet).

Attached is a dataset which is based on JIRA5.0_QAData.zip in which I created a simple qa-like workflow to help me reproduce the the bug in JRADEV-10913. This, and my lack of experience in setting up workflows, screens, etc, may well be the cause of the issue. However this sort of error should preferably not occur due to user error.

Steps to reproduce:

In IE9: 
- Restore attached data
- Create an issue in the QA project
- Transition the newly created issue to "In Progress" by clicking Workflow -> Start Progress
- Click "QA Time"
- Enter a tester name and submit the form.
-- Please note that sometimes the transition buttons under the Ops Bar do not update. If this occurs then it's certain that there's going to be an SQL error. In this case click Workflows -> Back to In Development
- If no error occurs transition "Back to Development"
- Repeat the above steps alternating tester value from admin to fred and back until an SQL error is displayed as follows:

{quote}
Could not move to history step for #12694: root cause: while inserting: [GenericEntity:OSHistoryStep][id,13052][caller,admin][startDate,2012-04-17 16:19:08.781][status,Not Done][owner,][finishDate,2012-04-17 16:19:32.143][actionId,791][stepId,3][dueDate,null][entryId,12694] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO PUBLIC.OS_HISTORYSTEP (ID, ENTRY_ID, STEP_ID, ACTION_ID, OWNER, START_DATE, DUE_DATE, FINISH_DATE, STATUS, CALLER) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (Unique constraint violation: SYS_IDX_107 in statement [INSERT INTO PUBLIC.OS_HISTORYSTEP (ID, ENTRY_ID, STEP_ID, ACTION_ID, OWNER, START_DATE, DUE_DATE, FINISH_DATE, STATUS, CALLER) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?)]))
{quote}

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28027].
  {panel}

If you [look at the documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Linking+Issues#LinkingIssues-Creatingalinktoanotherissue] there are only three ways to link issues:

# Type in the project key itself. That requires the user to sit there memorising project keys. Not something that anybody really wants to do.
# Select an item from their JIRA browsing history. This is useful, but you have to have visited the item before, sometimes you know of an item that is not in your history. For example, when a fellow developer leans over and tells you to add issue X.
# Select an item from a saved filter. This is good too but restricted in scope.

I would like to suggest that when you type text in the initial search box it literally searches JIRA for items that match that text; not only looks through your history. It would be more in keeping with customer expectations.

  {panel}

JIRA JQL is not integrated with other Atlassian products database, like Crucible or Bamboo. You are not allowed to search something like:

# What issues don't have a code review?
You can't determine which JIRA issues don't have a code review, there is not a JQL query for it, nothing like: "reviewOfIssue()" which might return the linked review list or "empty".
# What Bamboo builds have a certain JIRA issue linked to them?
In the JIRA dashboard, you can't setup a filter or JQL query that shows which JIRAs are linked to a build (or not).

The JQL from JIRA needs to be more "global".
fields.summary: JQL more integrated

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28020].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce*
 # Add a Date Time Picker custom field and associate it with the Create Issue Screen
 # Change your language to German
 # Create an issue
 # Click on the date picker for Due Date
 # Try to change to next month by hovering on the next month button
 # The description of the button will show at the bottom of the date picker: Nächst. Monat (Festhalten für Schnellauswahl)
 # The text is too long that the date picker resize
 # When it resize to be longer, my mouse cursor is not hovering the button anymore so the description text change and the date picker resize to be smaller again.
 # This create a loop resize effect
 # Click on the date time picker for the custom field created
 # Similar observation encountered when attempt to click on the minute area

*Workaround*
 (!) This workaround is applied to JIRA Server only. JIRA Cloud does not support the customisation of source files. See [Restricted functions in JIRA Cloud applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/restricted-functions-in-jira-cloud-applications-776636921.html].
 # Shutdown JIRA
 # Edit {{<jira-install>\atlassian-jira\includes\lib\calendar\lang\calendar-de-min.js}} so that it will have a shorter description text
 # Restart JIRA

*JIRA Cloud Workaround*

Use English language pack instead of German.

*Additional Information*
* This behaviour is consistent throughout the Chrome and Internet Explorer, but Firefox seems to be not affected by this, it is able to handle the long description by creating a new line.

* For JIRA Cloud, tested and verified that this is affecting on Firefox.
fields.summary: Date Picker and Date Time Picker unusable in German language

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28018].
  {panel}

Please improve the ability to require resources in the gadget XML. Here are a few ideas:

1. #requireResourcesForContext("some.context") - would do the same as webResourceManager is expected to do

2. #requireResourceIfPresent("some.module:key") - same as #requireResource, but if it can't be added, don't issue a warning

3. Not strictly for the gadgets, but if a <web-resource> module in atlassian-plugin.xml could depend on all resources in a context, such as:
{code:xml}
<web-resource key="my-resource">
  <dependency>normal.module:dependency</dependency>
  <dependency context="some.context"/> <!-- depends on all resources for the context -->
</web-resource>
{code}


All of these is needed to correctly include resources for the Structure plugin, because it needs them to, say, have inline edit of custom fields, which can be provided by other plugins and the editors might require additional web resources.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28009].
  {panel}

When writing emails to people, it's really nice to alt+Printscreen something, then paste it into the mail.

Rather than having to use windows snippets or MSPaint to paste the file, save it somewhere, then browse to that location (whether from the attachments browse... or by finding it via windows, then using Jira's drag/drop.

just... Paste!  would be so much nicer.  perhaps you guys have a little box that you click, then "paste" so that it's going into an "aware" part of the create form.

Would be awesome, increase usability of JIRA and save us time!
fields.summary: Gmail style clipboard paste in the create issue pane

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28000].
  {panel}

It would be nice, when taking an outage, to be able to push an announcement to users - regardless of where they are in the application - that shows both a countdown as well as a message related to an outage. For example: 

An outage will be taken on the system in 5:00 minutes. The outage is expected to last for 30:00 minutes. During this time, you will not have access to the system. Please wrap up your current activities. If you have questions or concerns regarding this outage, please contact a JIRA Administrator. 

The 5:00 minutes in this example would countdown. 
JIRA Administrator would be linked to the default JIRA Administrators contact page. 
The two times would be configurable by the Admin.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Admin, I can start a countdown viewable by users when taking a system outage so that users know to wrap up their activities before they lose access.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27999].
  {panel}

Recently we tightened up security in all JIRA OnDemand instances by not allowing arbitrary HTML in the project description. We fixed this vulnerability by only allowing plain text or [wiki markup|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=all] in the project description.

We would like to come up with a compromise if possible that still allows customers to accomplish what they were previously using the project description for in a secure way. In order for that to happen we would like to know how you were using the project description. Please comment on this issue to let us know how you have been using HTML in the project description.

Regards,

Roy Krishna
JIRA OnDemand Product Manager
fields.summary: JIRA OnDemand project description field
